parts.text: {"word":"grace","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"優雅さ、上品さ、洗練さ","english_definition":"elegance or beauty of movement or expression.","examples":[{"sentence":"She moves with such grace.","translation":"彼女はとても優雅に動く。"},{"sentence":"The dancer's grace captivated the audience.","translation":"そのダンサーの優雅さは観客を魅了した。"},{"sentence":"He handled the difficult situation with grace and diplomacy.","translation":"彼はその困難な状況を優雅さと外交手腕で乗り切った。"}],"collocations":["with grace (優雅に)","elegance and grace (優雅さと上品さ)","natural grace (生まれつきの優雅さ)","lack of grace (優雅さの欠如)"],"synonyms":["elegance","poise","finesse","refinement","charm","beauty"],"antonyms":["awkwardness","clumsiness","gauche"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"（神の）恵み、恩寵、慈悲","english_definition":"divine favor or blessing.","examples":[{"sentence":"By the grace of God, we survived the storm.","translation":"神の恵みによって、私たちは嵐を乗り越えた。"},{"sentence":"He was saved by grace.","translation":"彼は神の恵みによって救われた。"},{"sentence":"She accepted the award with grace and humility.","translation":"彼女は恵みと謙虚さをもってその賞を受け取った。"}],"collocations":["divine grace (神の恵み)","saving grace (救いの恵み)","act of grace (恩赦)","fall from grace (失脚、堕落)"],"synonyms":["favor","blessing","kindness","mercy","compassion","benevolence"],"antonyms":["disgrace","condemnation","curse"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"（食事の）感謝の祈り、食前の祈り","english_definition":"a prayer said before or after a meal expressing thanks for the food.","examples":[{"sentence":"Let us say grace before we eat.","translation":"食事の前に感謝の祈りをしましょう。"},{"sentence":"The family always says grace at dinner.","translation":"その家族はいつも夕食時に感謝の祈りをする。"}],"collocations":["say grace (感謝の祈りをする)","offer grace (感謝の祈りを捧げる)","table grace (食卓での感謝の祈り)"],"synonyms":["blessing","prayer","thanksgiving"],"antonyms":[]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"飾る、美しくする、光栄を与える","english_definition":"to lend beauty or charm to; to honor or dignify.","examples":[{"sentence":"Her presence graced the occasion.","translation":"彼女の存在がその場に華を添えた。"},{"sentence":"Flowers graced the table.","translation":"花がテーブルを飾っていた。"},{"sentence":"The queen graced the event with her presence.","translation":"女王がご臨席され、そのイベントに光栄を与えた。"}],"collocations":["grace an occasion (機会に華を添える)","grace a table (テーブルを飾る)","grace a room (部屋を飾る)","grace with presence (臨席して光栄を与える)"],"synonyms":["adorn","embellish","beautify","decorate","honor","dignify"],"antonyms":["disgrace","dishonor","mar","deface"]}],"etymology":{"value":"古フランス語の「grace」（好意、感謝、美しさ）から派生し、さらにラテン語の「gratia」（好意、魅力、感謝）に由来する。ラテン語の「gratus」（喜ばしい、感謝される）に関連する。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ɡreɪs/","syllables":"grace"},"inflection":{"noun_plural":"graces","verb_forms":{"present_simple":["grace","graces"],"past_simple":"graced","past_participle":"graced","present_participle":"gracing"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**grace**」は、名詞としては「優雅さ」「神の恵み」「食前の祈り」といった意味があり、動詞としては「飾る」「光栄を与える」という意味があります。文脈によって意味が大きく異なるため、注意が必要です。「優雅さ」の意味では、人の動作や振る舞いの美しさを表し、「神の恵み」の意味では、神からの慈悲や恩恵を指します。「食前の祈り」は、食事に対する感謝の気持ちを表す習慣です。動詞としては、何かを美しくしたり、特別な存在が場所や機会に光栄を与えたりする際に使われます。","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ She has a lot of graces.","correct":"✓ She has a lot of grace.","note":"「優雅さ」の意味では、graceは通常不可算名詞として扱われます。複数の「優雅さ」を指す場合は、具体的な行動や特徴を指す場合に限り可算名詞として使われることがあります。"},{"incorrect":"✗ He graced to the occasion.","correct":"✓ He graced the occasion.","note":"動詞のgraceは他動詞なので、前置詞は不要です。目的語を直接取ります。"},{"incorrect":"✗ They said a grace before eating the meal.","correct":"✓ They said grace before eating the meal.","note":"「感謝の祈りをする」という場合は、冠詞なしで"say grace"という表現を使います。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["graceful (形容詞: 優雅な)","gracefully (副詞: 優雅に)","graceless (形容詞: 優雅さのない、無作法な)","gracious (形容詞: 親切な、丁寧な、優雅な)","graciously (副詞: 親切に、丁寧に、優雅に)"],"idioms_phrases":["saving grace (救いとなる美点、長所)","fall from grace (失脚、堕落)","with good grace (快く、喜んで)","there but for the grace of God go I (自分もそうなる可能性があった)"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"中頻度 (Moderate frequency)","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"「**grace**」は、いくつかの異なる意味を持つ単語です。最も一般的な意味は「優雅さ」で、動きや外見の美しさを指します。また、「神の恵み」という意味もあり、これは神からの好意や祝福を意味します。食事の前に言う「感謝の祈り」も「grace」と呼ばれます。動詞としては、「飾る」や「光栄を与える」という意味で使われ、何かを美しくしたり、特別な存在が場所や機会に華を添えたりすることを表します。文脈によって意味が異なるため、注意が必要です。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The ballerina moved across the stage with effortless **grace**.","translation":"そのバレリーナは、たやすく舞台を横切るように優雅に動いた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"優雅さ"},{"sentence":"She accepted the criticism with **grace** and understanding.","translation":"彼女は優雅さと理解をもって批判を受け入れた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"優雅さ"},{"sentence":"We thanked God for his **grace** and mercy.","translation":"私たちは神の恵みと慈悲に感謝した。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"神の恵み"},{"sentence":"The family always says **grace** before dinner.","translation":"その家族はいつも夕食の前に感謝の祈りをする。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"感謝の祈り"},{"sentence":"Her presence **graced** the opening of the new art gallery.","translation":"彼女の出席が新しい美術館のオープニングに華を添えた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"飾る"},{"sentence":"Flowers **graced** the tables at the wedding reception.","translation":"結婚披露宴のテーブルは花で飾られていた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"飾る"}]}
